figure_1: Preoperative image taken during the time of operation, 18 days after application of the ointment, revealing a 20-mm circular defect distal to the first metacarpophalangeal joint.
figure_2: Intraoperative image of the defect and rhomboid flap design. The flap margin marked A was transposed to align with the wound margin marked a.
figure_3: Image of the transposed rhomboid flap now covering the wound bed and sutured into place using single non-resorbable nylon sutures.
figure_4: Postoperative image taken six weeks after surgery showing a well-healed rhomboid flap covering the entirety of the previous defect.
